notes: Six Modakekes were burned to death in a clash with the Ife ethnic militia. Their bodies were later recovered in the adjacent village of Otin.
Twelve army officers are arrested following a failed coup plot on the current ruler General Sani Abacha. Protests against the plot followed.
A Nigerian oil group takes two Britons, an American and an Australian hostage in protest over their working conditions. "
Some 3,000 people demonstrated peacefully in the home town of General Shehu YarAdua, protesting his death in prison last week
a bomb exploded at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, killing one

Five international workers from Western Geophysical were taken hostage by armed gunmen and held on a houseboat off the coast of the southwestern Ondo State due to a dispute between the oil firm and local villagers
Eight are killed in continued fighting between the Ife and Modakeke during a peace meeting between the two parties.
Communal violence continued, raising the death toll to 20
A bomb intended for a military target exploded prematurely in a populated center. No injury or death reported.
About 15 people feared dead in ethnic clashes in Osun over the past four days. Fighting continued Friday, preventing elections from going ahead
About 15 people feared dead in ethnic clashes in Osun over the past four days. Fighting continued Friday, preventing elections from going ahead
Several buildings were destroyed by fire in communal violence including the Ife monarchs estate
44 people are killed when Ijaw members attack the people of Ikpokpo village over the recent relocation of a local government headquarters.
A bomb packed with nails explodes as a military bus crosses an intersection wounding eight. "
An opposition group known as NADECO sets off several bombs in Lagos, no reported injuries or death. "
three students seriously wounded in a clash with police at the University of Ibadan. Police were preventing students from protesting the lack if water and electricity on campus

source: Reuters News; New Agency of Nigeria
notes: 24 are dead in a tribal conflict involving machetes; other sources reported the use of sophisiticated weapons suggesting mercenary involvement

Ekakpamre Communal Militia carried out their earlier threat of forced closure of the Ughelli West flow station. The community demands an improved access road and a share of 19000 bpd output that is typical of the station. "
A police officer was shot and killed by armed robbers in Akure.
12 dead and 10 injured in renewed fighting between Ife and Modakeke communities
A group of Ijaws have vandalized a oil flow station in Warri during ethnic clashes with the Itsekiri"
A group of armed robbers kill four police officers in Lagos.

Fresh fighting in Nigerias oil producing Niger delta has forced oil giant Royal Dutch Shell Group to cut Nigerian oil output by more than 10 percent. This follows an attack by armed youths on the Nembe Creek Oil facility.
Ijaws take revenge on a previous Itsekiri attack killing 10 of them.
Ten people died in a riot that was in response to the military governors dissolution of local government councils in the state and relocated all Kutaf ethnic villages.
Moshood Abiola a pro-democracy magazine editor has beaten and arrested by police in the Ikeja district of Lagos.
Seven killed and seven houses razed in communal violence between the Jukun, Chamba and Kutep communities after the removal of elected local council officials
Non-violent activity: Militants from Gelegele force an oil company to stop production in the area.
Allied militant villagers forcibly stop operation aboard an oil rig when they chase away its operators.
A group cause an explosion at a power station in Port Harcourt which kills six workers.
Police arrest 25 Ijaw militants for destructive activities.
Bomb explodes at Reconciliation Committee chairmans home
Thirty in a span of three days are killed in a renewed ethnic clash between the Ife and Moadakeke peoples over the relocation of a government office in the region.
Police forcibly stop a party in honor of a detained human rights campaigner Frederick Fasehun.
Gangs of Moslem youths paraded through the streets of a northern Nigerian city on Wednesday in protest over an eclipse of the moon saying it was caused by ""sins of infidels."""
Protesting oil workers occupy rig being used by Mobil Corp off the southeast Nigerian coast.
Protesting oil workers hold international staff hostage and occupy a rig being used by Mobil Corp off the southeast Nigerian coast.
Another student killed in a clash between cult groups at the Unigersity of Lagos
Rally to demonstrate support for the administration of Lt-Col Mohamed Bawah and to denounce the recent bomb blast in Ado-Ekiti
An unknown group ignites a bomb by an Army barracks injuring several.
One student shot and killed in a clash between cult groups at the Unigersity of Lagos
Eight are injured including children due to a bomb blast aimed at the convoy of the military governor of Ekiti State.
4 killed and many injured in renewed ethnic fighting over the weekend which included an alleged attack on the Modakeke King in Arokomo village, Osun state
Students of government schools launch street protests over non-payment of the wages of their teachers.
Six villages burn due to the ongoing ethnic clashes which begun at Ife.

A group of Kokori people have begun a protest over the activities of Royal/Dutch Shell in the region. The villagers allege the oil company has been drilling in the area for the past 39 years and has failed to pay local people reasonable compensation.
Nigerian pro-democracy campaigners who hoped to turn presidential contender Moshood Abiolas 60th birthday into an anti-military protest were locked out of his presidential palace by his family.
Ethnic violence in Ife spreads to nearby villages as the death toll increases
some people were burnt alive during ethnic clashes in Ife and Modakeke
some people were burnt alive during ethnic clashes in Ife and Modakeke
Protests in Aleibgri.
A large bomb was placed at the center of a large market in Lagos but defused
Ethnic clash in Ife Ife area.
Three are killed and sixty hurt during a clash between two villages over the relocation of a local government headquarters.
Armed robbers kill a divisional police officer in Lagos and snatch his car.

assoc_actor_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
notes: About 3,000 students under the auspices of the National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS protested against Abachas bid to remain in office
Two drivers and one student die in a riot over the increase fares of bus prices. Included in the damage several burned buildings and automobiles.
One is dead when Islamic extremists clash with police in Kaduna.
Clashes erupted between two Bayelsa state villages when a customer purchased an amount of alcohol then killed the seller.
Thirty arrested and six hospitalized when members of the Ijaw community clash with members of the police and military over unknown reasons.
A bomb set by NADECO detonated in Port Harcourt killing a young boy and injured two others. "
An armed group fighting amongst itself over a female student kills a bystander."
Eight die in a clash between two neighboring communities over the installation of a new leader.
Five soldiers are killed when they confront a group involved in illegal lumber activities.
The Nigerian Liberation Organization a militant group explodes a bomb near an army barracks killing two civilians.
Five students were killed in a violent clash between rival secret campus cults at the University of Benin
eight students were brutalised over a gossip magazine in a violent clash between rival secret campus cults at the University of Benin
A large group of youths protest in the streets of Kano due to an extreme fuel shortage.
Nineteen are dead in an ethnic clash set of by the arresting of a man alleged to have been harassing people in Warri. Included in the damage are 18 houses burnt.
A naval amphibious battalion attacks a Delta State village killing five in a revenge operation sparked by a recent kidnapping.
Twenty three people died in two days of clashes between cattle hearers fighting over grazing land in northeastern Nigeria.
Six are killed when a militant group detonates a bomb at a mosque.
Gunmen shot and killed a former minister in the eastern Enugu state, Charles Nnachetam and stole his luxury car.
A bomb blast in Ibadan injures two soldiers and one police officer.
Youths from Ogbo-Lombiri village rioted against villagers in Bassambiri, targetting Shell to gain attention, and forcing oil wells to briefly shut down
Two are killed in fighting between Ijaws and Itsekiri tribes over land.
Several are injured when unknown men detonate a bomb near a military truck in Lagos.
A child was killed in riots after an arson attack which razed a large part of the Onitsha market, the biggest market in Nigeria

Four people have been killed in riots after an arson attack which razed a large part of the Onitsha market, the biggest market in Nigeria. Police opened fire and used teargas in battles with the rioters
A police officer dies when he is stampeded in a soccer riot.
Two suspects awaiting trial were killed in prison via torture by police.
At least five people were killed and an itsekiri village torched during renewed interethnic fighting
a second itsekiri villages was torched during renewed interethnic fighting
Five more killed during Warri violence between warring communities.
Five killed as Warri violence spreads to a nearby village.
Lagos State University (LASU) has been closed temporarily following clashes between campus cults during the Miss LASU contest in which two students were killed and about a dozen others injured
a police officer was killed and several others were wounded during a recent ethnic clash between soldiers and policemen in kano
Five die in continuing clashes between Ijaw and Itsekiri militias.
Nigerian Troops were deployed to restore order in Warri
Eight die in a clash between Ijaw and Itsekiri as violence in Warri continues over a movement of a government headquarters in region.
Militant youths attack an oil company boat on a river and kidnap the Captain.
Five more are killed as ethnic fighting continues.
Clashes broke out after an Itsekiri leaders son was found murdered. Itsekiri and Ijaw exchanged fire and a police post, Warris main market and several vehicles were burnt down. At least 2 were killed

source: Agence France Presse; Radio Kudirat Nigeria
notes: the Ijaw accused Itsekiris of killing 44 people in a raid on a coastal Ijaw village (reported on Thursday)
Fifteen are killed and nearly seventy injured in a clash between the Beroms and Hausa immigrants when the Beroms discover a dead body of a kinsman and assume the Hausa are responsible.
the Panyams and the Gindiris clashed in the village of Changai over the nomination of a new village chief. Eight people died, several were wounded and several homes burned down.
hundreds of itesekiri women and youths embarked on a peaceful demonstration against the suspension of the newly elected chairman of warrsouth local government council
Several people were killed when an Itsekiri village was lit on fire overnight in southern Nigerias oil-rich Niger delta

assoc_actor_2: CNC: Congress for National Consensus Party
notes: Four people were killed and 29 declared missing when fighting broke out between supporters of rival political parties involved in re-run local polls
Sporadic rioting over the period of a week leaves three Ijaw tribesmen dead as they and Itserki militia raided each others homes and businesses.
Three Ijaw militants were killed as they rioted against civilians and oil companies in the area.
Three dead and about 390000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude oil is feared to be of risk because of protests in the Midwestern town of Warri over relocation of a local government headquarters.
At least 19 people were killed in a dispute over oil-wells between Gbaregolo, part of the Urhobo community, and Esanma, who belong to the Ijaw ethnic group
Attackers seriously hurt three more workers.
Angered that their tribes must relocate their local government headquarters the Ijaw and Itserki take nearly 100 Royal Dutch/Shell workers hostage.
A group of armed robbers kill two members of ""Operation Sweep"" combined anti-crime task force of the navy police and soldiers."
Attackers injure six staff members of the Royal/Dutch Shell corporation and hold 127 for ransom. "
Police shoot tear gas into a group of 2000 rioters who claimed election officials of vote fraud.
Rioting students calling for the release of Moshood Abiola, jailed opposition leader, storm a polling station at a university.
Three people died in violence related to Nigerias municipal elections in Rivers State
One woman was shot and killed and several were injured during youth protests related to Nigerias municipal elections

assoc_actor_2: Institute for Human Rights and Humanitarian Law
notes: Police and security officials allegedly raided the offices of the Institute for Human Rights and Humanitarian Law based in Port Harcourt, seizing documents and detaining the organizations secretary
Twenty foreigners - 1 American, 3 Britons, 16 Frenchmen - held by tribesmen who took over an oil platform off the Nigerian coast near the town of Warri
Government forces gain territory from RUF in Lagos State.
Four more are killed during ongoing fighting between ethnic groups in Osun State.
Tire manufacturer Dunlop was forced to close its factory when workers there rioted for a pay increase.

actor1: CNC: Congress for National Consensus Party
notes: Two are dead in an election primary clash between two opposing parties.
Clashes between two Christian religious groups paralyze business in southeastern Calabar town.
A Catholic priest was shot dead in his home by unknown men.
A police officer kills one and injured three others when a bus driver refused to pay a bribe at a road checkpoint.
Gunmen kill a Logos based businessman in his home.
A French oil engineer was shot and killed by gunmen.
A bomb exploded as a military bus passed, seven were injured
One dead following an attack by the military on a Delta town.
One Ijaw dead and 58 arrested when Nigerian armed forces storm their village in retaliation for the kidnapping of their personnel.
Two students died and several were injured when the followers of two campus cults clashed at Lagos State University

source: Associated Press Worldstream; PanAfrican News Agency
notes: Riots broke out at a prayer meeting to mark the end of Ramadan. Police opened fire to control a crowd of 400 Shiite Muslims, after marchers attacked them with stones and other weapons . Witnesses reported five deaths, police reported only one. The Shiites were reported by some sources to be protesting the military government. Another report said the Shiites were confronted by other Muslims after hoisting their flag at the Central Mosque.
Nineteen are killed in a land dispute in Warri.
An officer of the student union was knived to death when fighting broke out amongst two groups of students, one group of about 3,000 students had gathered to protest alleged changes to tuition fees
Property destruction: A group set fire to a telephone exchange.
students riot over school fees at the University of Nigeria, enugu campus
Bode Olajumoke, opposition party leader and his associates attacked, robbed, by four gunmen and would-be kidnappers north of Lagos, after a spate of attacks on opposition politicians in Nigeria.
students riot over school fees at the University of Nigeria, nsukka campus
thousands of Gummi local government indigenes stormed the of Sokoto State House to protest a proposal that Gummi LGA be excised from Sokoto State and merged with Zamfara

six shots were fired at Abraham Adesanya, the deputy chairman of the largest opposition coalition as he drove through the heart of the business district in Lagos, he suffered minor injuries. Opposition leaders have been targetted by the military regime.
Four performersy are injured when a bomb explodes in Lagos.
Two doctors and four nurses were beaten to a state of unconsciousness over the weekend by members of the State Security Service, said the National Association of Resident Doctors of Nigeria
The body of one of four soldiers gone missing while trying to quell the violence by the Ijaw militias was found.
Three are killed in a battle between militant Ijaw youths and the military during a shootout.
three people were killed in a revenge attack during communal clashes on Thursday - related to a dispute between rivals over a traditional Ekori title
At least 20 people including a police sergeant killed in a dispute between rivals in the Ekori community seeking a traditional title
A blast believed to have been caused by a bomb killed one soldier ( a second died later) and wounded 29 others traveling on a military bus near the Abate Military Barracks in Lagos
